title: Drawing, Design for a [Needle Threader or Punch ?] and a Pair of Scissors with Handles Formed by Half-figures of  Sea Monsters
title_raw: Design for a [Needle Threader or Punch ?] and a Pair of Scissors with Handles Formed by Half-figures of  Sea Monsters
medium: Pen and ink, brush and gray wash on heavy off-white paper
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in pen and ink at upper left: n. r.; and again at upper right: 33R
Verso: Inscribed in graphite across page: D - 12 - / Middle Row/ left. /Leave paper ; and again in red crayon ?: TM [?]
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle showing two objects with, possibly, a punch or needle threader at left and a pair of scissors whose handles are formed by half-figures of sea monsters.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for a [Needle Threader or Punch ?] and a Pair of Scissors with Handles Formed by Half-figures of  Sea Monsters. Pen and ink, brush and gray wash on heavy off-white paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5367.
